purpose_text.para: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC virtual CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

field_description.para: ICV_CTLR_EL1.ExtRange is an alias of ICC_CTLR_EL1.ExtRange.

field_value_description.para: CPU interface does not support INTIDs in the range 1024..8191.

listitem.content: Behavior is UNPREDICTABLE if the IRI delivers an interrupt in the range 1024 to 8191 to the CPU interface.

note.para: Arm strongly recommends that the IRI is not configured to deliver interrupts in this range to a PE that does not support them.

field_value_description.para: CPU interface supports INTIDs in the range 1024..8191

listitem.content: All INTIDs in the range 1024..8191 are treated as requiring deactivation.

field_description.para: Range Selector Support. Possible values are:

field_value_description.para: Targeted SGIs with affinity level 0 values of 0 - 15 are supported.
Targeted SGIs with affinity level 0 values of 0 - 255 are supported.

field_description.para: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored. Possible values are:

field_value_description.para: The virtual CPU interface logic only supports zero values of Affinity 3 in SGI generation System registers.
The virtual CPU interface logic supports nonzero values of Affinity 3 in SGI generation System registers.

field_description.para: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored. Indicates whether the virtual CPU interface supports local generation of SEIs:

field_value_description.para: The virtual CPU interface logic does not support local generation of SEIs.
The virtual CPU interface logic supports local generation of SEIs.

field_description.para: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of virtual interrupt identifier bits supported:
Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.
An implementation must implement at least 32 levels of physical priority (5 priority bits).

note.para: This field always returns the number of priority bits implemented.

field_description.para: The division between group priority and subpriority is defined in the binary point registers ICV_BPR0_EL1 and ICV_BPR1_EL1.
Virtual EOI mode. Controls whether a write to an End of Interrupt register also deactivates the virtual interrupt:

field_value_description.para: ICV_EOIR0_EL1 and ICV_EOIR1_EL1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICV_DIR_EL1 are UNPREDICTABLE.
ICV_EOIR0_EL1 and ICV_EOIR1_EL1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICV_DIR_EL1 provides interrupt deactivation functionality.

field_description.para: Common Binary Point Register. Controls whether the same register is used for interrupt preemption of both virtual Group 0 and virtual Group 1 interrupts:

field_value_description.para: ICV_BPR1_EL1 determines the preemption group for virtual Group 1 interrupts.
Non-secure reads of ICV_BPR1_EL1 return ICV_BPR0_EL1 plus one, saturated to 0b111. Non-secure writes to ICV_BPR1_EL1 are ignored.
Secure reads of ICV_BPR1_EL1 return ICV_BPR0_EL1. Secure writes of ICV_BPR1_EL1 modify ICV_BPR0_EL1.
